intro: Dalea botterii var. atrocyanea, commonly known as the dark-blue milkvetch, is a perennial legume native to the southwestern United States. It is characterized by its striking violet to deep blue flower clusters that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its compound leaves are pinnately arranged, and the stems are often branched and covered in fine hairs. This variant is distinguished by its darker floral coloration compared to other Dalea species.
